intro: Conostylis candicans subsp. flavifolia, commonly known as the golden conostylis, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its erect, slender stems and small, clustered inflorescences that produce yellow flowers. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often covered with fine hairs. This subspecies is typically found in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as woodlands and grasslands.
